title: 5 Fun & Spooky Halloween Recipes
author: Chino Valley Ranchers
content:
Halloween is just a few weeks away and if you haven’t started planning the appetizers for your party, then here are a few ideas to get your creative juices flowing.


  1. Skulled Deviled Eggs

Create a spooky version of deviled eggs perfect for Halloween. For this recipe, you’ll need one dozen hard boiled Chino Valley Ranchers eggs, ¼ cup mayonnaise, ¼ cup roasted sweet red pepper strips, two teaspoons Dijon mustard, two teaspoons cider vinegar, one teaspoon paprika, ¼ teaspoon salt, ¼ teaspoon pepper, and one cup finely crushed corn chips.


View the recipe.


  1. Spooky Monster Eyes Halloween Deviled Eggs

Another take on deviled eggs, but this time you’ll need a paint brush to do some decorating. To make these spooky monster eyes, you’ll need 10 to 12 hard boiled Chino Valley Ranchers eggs, one ripe avocado, two tablespoons dill relish, a handful of sliced black olives, a few teaspoons of mayonnaise, two teaspoon lemon juice, salt and pepper to taste, red food coloring, and a soft (unused) paint brush.


View the recipe.


  1. Halloween Blueberry Mummy Muffins

Get ready for some fun mummy wrapping — aka decorating — for these blueberry muffins. You’ll need quite a long list of ingredients, but they’re definitely worth it! View the ingredients in the recipe link below.


View the recipe.


  1. Baked Mummy Jalapeno Poppers

More cute than spooky, these baked mummy jalapeno poppers are sure to be a standout on your appetizer table. To make 12 jalapeno poppers, you’ll need five ounces cream cheese, three ounces shredded Cheddar cheese, salt and pepper to taste, six large jalapeno peppers, one can of refrigerated crescent rolls, one Chino Valley Ranchers pasture raised egg, one tablespoon milk, ¼ cup all-purpose flour, and 24 candy eyeballs.


View the recipe.


  1. Jack-O-Lantern Pumpkin Pancakes

Make these for your family Halloween morning and to put everyone in the spirit. You could even ask the kids to help. These pancakes are fun and easy to make. You’ll need one cup all-purpose flour, one cup quick cooking oats, ¼ cup brown sugar, two teaspoons baking powder, ¼ teaspoon cinnamon, ¼ teaspoon ground cloves, ½ teaspoon salt, one cup milk, one Chino Valley Ranchers egg, ¾ cup canned pumpkin, two tablespoons vegetable oil, and ¾ cup semisweet chocolate chips.


View the recipe.
